name: COUNTY OF ALLEGHENY, a Political Subdivision of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania v. John V. CAPOZZI and Margaret A. Capozzi, Appellants

judges: Before JONES, C. J., and EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
parties: COUNTY OF ALLEGHENY, a Political Subdivision of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania v. John V. CAPOZZI and Margaret A. Capozzi, Appellants.

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM.
Decree vacated. Case remanded for immediate hearing. Motions to quash denied. Each party to bear own costs.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Allen N. Brunwasser, Pittsburgh, for appellants.
Stephen A. Zappala, Wayne D. Gerhold, Frank P. Tuplin, Pittsburgh, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
346 A.2d 63
COUNTY OF ALLEGHENY, a Political Subdivision of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania v. John V. CAPOZZI and Margaret A. Capozzi, Appellants.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Sept. 23, 197-5.
Decided Oct. 30, 1975.
Allen N. Brunwasser, Pittsburgh, for appellants.
Stephen A. Zappala, Wayne D. Gerhold, Frank P. Tuplin, Pittsburgh, for appellee.
Before JONES, C. J., and EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
